title: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
meta_description: Learn calories in bottle wine for a standard 750ml serving, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition tweaks for red, white, or sweet varieties.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine, 12.5% ABV, typical serving size; calories primarily from alcohol and residual sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, brand, ABV, sweetness, and serving size. Check labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine has about 625 kcal, with low carbs and no fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to sweet white wine (higher sugars)
Add mixers like soda (per bottle equivalent)

faqs.q: How many calories in bottle wine typically?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine bottle.

faqs.q: Does wine have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Dry wines have low carbs (~20 g per bottle) and minimal sugars (~4 g); sweeter wines have more.

faqs.q: Calories in bottle wine vs. beer?
faqs.a: Wine bottle (750 ml) has ~625 kcal; a 6-pack of beer (similar volume) often 600-900 kcal depending on type.

faqs.q: What affects calories in bottle wine?
faqs.a: ABV, residual sugars, and type (red vs. white vs. sparkling); higher alcohol or sweetness increases calories.

faqs.q: Is protein or fat in wine?
faqs.a: Negligible protein (~1 g) and zero fat per bottle; energy mainly from alcohol.
